results.title: The safety and tolerability of lisinopril in clinical trials.
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@Hypotension@@@, @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@orthostatic effects@@@, or @<m>DISEASE_Dizziness</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@ following the initial @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ dose occurred infrequently in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

results.title: Clinical experience with lisinopril. Observations on safety and tolerability.
results.text_hl: In the @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ population, the most frequent adverse events reported were @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Dizziness</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@, @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@, @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@, @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhoea@@@ and @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@, although not all of these events were thought to be related to @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@; 6.1% discontinued @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ due to adverse clinical events, most commonly @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@ and @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@.

citations.NLM: Cameron HA, Higgins TJ. Clinical experience with lisinopril. Observations on safety and tolerability. J Hum Hypertens. 1989 Jun;3 Suppl 1():177-86. PMID: 2550641
citations.BibTeX: @article{2550641, title={Clinical experience with lisinopril. Observations on safety and tolerability.}, author={Cameron HA and Higgins TJ}, journal={J Hum Hypertens}, volume={3 Suppl 1}, pages={177-86}}

results.title: [A multicenter study of lisinopril in the treatment of mild to moderate hypertension].
results.text_hl: The efficacy, tolerability and impact on quality of life of the @GENE_AP2B1 @GENE_163 @@@ACE@@@ inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ were evaluated in a 12-week open, multicenter post-marketing surveillance study. 233 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@, 45 years and over with diastolic @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@blood pressure@@@ (DBP) 95-105 mm Hg were followed after a washout period of 7 days. 22 withdrew due either to adverse reactions, mainly @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@ (4.3%) and @<m>DISEASE_Dizziness</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@ (3%), or noncompliance.

citations.NLM: Yodfat Y. [A multicenter study of lisinopril in the treatment of mild to moderate hypertension]. Harefuah. 1995 Jul;129(1-2):26-9, 78. PMID: 7557704
citations.BibTeX: @article{7557704, title={[A multicenter study of lisinopril in the treatment of mild to moderate hypertension].}, author={Yodfat Y}, journal={Harefuah}, volume={129}, number={1-2}, pages={26-9, 78}}

results.title: Review of international safety data for lisinopril-hydrochlorothiazide combination treatment.
results.text_hl: In clinical trials, adverse experiences in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ treated with a @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@-@CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@ combination were @<m>DISEASE_Dizziness</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@ (7.5%), @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@ (5.2%), @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@ (3.9%), @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@ (3.7%), @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@orthostatic effects@@@ (3.2%), @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhoea@@@ (2.5%), @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@ (2.2%) and @DISEASE_Respiratory_Tract_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D012141 @@@upper respiratory tract infection@@@ (2.2%).
